high.mackenzie.autumn.lang.compiler.utils

Class Design

  • java.lang.Object
    • high.mackenzie.autumn.lang.compiler.utils.Design

  • public final class Design
extends java.lang.Object
    An instance of this class analyzes a the type of a design.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Design(IInterfaceType design)
      Sole Constructor.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean detectCircularInheritance()
      This method detects both circular inheritance.

      This method finds all the getters within the design.

      This method finds all the methods in the design, excluding the property setters and getters.

      This method performs all necessary type-checking on a design.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Design

        public Design(IInterfaceType design)
        Sole Constructor.
        Parameters:
        design - is the type of the design.

    • Method Detail

      • type

        public IInterfaceType type()
        This method retrieves the type being analyzed herein.
        Returns:
        the design.

      • detectCircularInheritance

        public boolean detectCircularInheritance()
        This method detects both circular inheritance.
        Returns:
        true, if and only if the design experiences circular inheritance.

      • types

        public java.util.Set<IDeclaredType> types()
        This method returns the set of all the types that the design is a subtype of. Remember, this includes the type itself.
        Returns:
        the aforesaid immutable set.

      • supertypes

        public java.util.Set<IDeclaredType> supertypes()
        This method returns the set of all the types that the design is a proper subtype of.
        Returns:
        the aforesaid immutable set.

      • setters

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,SetterList> setters()
        This method finds all the setters within the design.

        A key in the returned map is the name of the property. A value in the returned map is a sorted list of setter overrides. The sorted list is needed, due to covariant properties.

        Returns:
        the aforedescribed immutable map.

      • getters

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,GetterList> getters()
        This method finds all the getters within the design.

        A key in the returned map is the name of the property. A value in the returned map is a sorted list of getter overrides. The sorted list is needed, due to covariant properties.

        Returns:
        the aforedescribed immutable map.

      • methods

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,MethodList> methods()
        This method finds all the methods in the design, excluding the property setters and getters.

        A key in the returned map is the name plus parameter list descriptor of the method. A value in the returned map is a sorted list of method overrides.

        Returns:
        the aforedescribed immutable map.

      • typeof

        public IVariableType typeof(java.lang.String name)
        This method determines the type of value that a property accepts.
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the property.
        Returns:
        the aforesaid type, or null, if the property does not exist.

      • reportErrors

        public void reportErrors()
        This method performs all necessary type-checking on a design.
